main event: A bright round object was observed flying at high speed in Belton, Missouri on August 19, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a grapefruit and traveled to the northwest before disappearing in 10 seconds.,Telephone conversation details were recorded between TSGT WT Richards and Captain Harper regarding the sighting.,The sighting was reported by an aircraft observer who described the object as a white round object about 10 feet in diameter.,The sighting is suspected to be a meteor based on comments in the report.,A delay in the report was noted as it was not made until 7 days later.
witness description: Men of good repute, including an aircraft observer
